intro: Sida amplexifolia, commonly known as broadleaf sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its alternate, palmately lobed leaves that often clasping the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Sida amplexifolia is valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
